title: ABS Hydraulic Modulator/ECM - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

The ABS ECM is an integral part of the ABS modulator. Under no circumstances should the ECM be removed from the ABS modulator. If a new ECM is required, repair is by replacement of the ABS modulator and ECM as an assembly only.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
One of the front brake calipers and the rear brake caliper will require removing and the pistons pushed out to back bleed the master cylinder as part of the brake bleeding procedure, see
Make sure no damage is made to the brake pad material when moving the brake pads.
Allowing the brake pads to come into contact with each other or sharp objects may cause the material to crack or break.
Damage to the brake pads may result in reduced braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Remove one of the front caliper mounting bolts and slide the caliper off the brake discs.

Using a suitable a flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the front brake lever until the plate is held by the brake pads.
Pull the front brake lever towards the handlebar until a small amount of pressure is felt. Cable tie the brake lever to this position.
Remove the rear wheel hanger from the rear brake caliper assembly and support the brake caliper.

Using a suitable a flat metal plate approximately 2 mm thick and 30 to 50 mm wide (for example a gasket scraper) between the brake pads, pump the rear brake pedal until the plate is held by the brake pads.
Note the routing of the brake lines and battery negative cable on the right hand side of the seat bridge for installation.
Remove the cable tie and position the main harness to the right hand side of seat bridge.
Reposition the main harness on the right hand side of the seat bridge to access a fixing.
Detach the two brake lines and the battery negative cable from the left hand side of the seat bridge.
Remove and discard the fixings securing the seat bridge to the frame. Collect the washers and remove the bridge.
ABS Modulator Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
Before the disassembly of any brake lines in the ABS hydraulic circuit, always mark their position so that they can be returned to the same position when assembled.
If the brake lines are incorrectly assembled the performance of the ABS system will be seriously compromised, leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
When disconnecting the brake hoses from the ABS modulator, a small amount of brake fluid may seep out of the brake hoses.
Protect the area around the ABS modulator to collect any spilled brake fluid.
Taking care not to bend the brake lines, remove the four brake line unions.
Detach the brake lines from the ABS modulator. Support the brake lines with the union end uppermost and discard the sealing washers.
Release the fixing and remove the anti-rotation moulding. Discard the fixing.
Remove the front fixings for the ABS modulator bracket.

body.name: ABS modulator bracket front fixings B02333

body.body: Release the rear fixings and remove the ABS modulator and bracket assembly.
Release the fixings and remove the ABS modulator. Discard the fixings.
